title: Equality: Symmetry and Transitivity
description:
Prove two fundamental properties of equality: symmetry (`a = b -> b = a`) and transitivity (`a = b -> b = c -> a = c`).

**Goal:** `forall (A : Type) (a b c : A), a = b -> b = a` (first part)
and `forall (A : Type) (a b c : A), a = b -> b = c -> a = c` (second part)

Combined into a conjunction for this exercise. Use `rewrite` to manipulate equalities.
hints: Use `split` to separate the conjunction into two goals
For symmetry: introduce the hypothesis `a = b`, then `rewrite H` transforms the goal
For transitivity: introduce both hypotheses, then chain `rewrite` calls
template:
Theorem eq_sym_trans : forall (A : Type) (a b c : A),
  (a = b -> b = a) /\ (a = b -> b = c -> a = c).
Proof.
  (* Your proof here *)
Admitted.
solution:
Theorem eq_sym_trans : forall (A : Type) (a b c : A),
  (a = b -> b = a) /\ (a = b -> b = c -> a = c).
Proof.
  intros A a b c.
  split.
  - intros H. rewrite H. reflexivity.
  - intros H1 H2. rewrite H1. exact H2.
Qed.
